instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> tb0t error
threads.message:
This board has slight liquid damage and was ultrasound cleaned. It work but very slow and fan at max. After run ASD I got these error: TB0T, TB1T, TB2T

What should I check?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> tb0t error
threads.message: <TRANSISTOR>Q5820</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q5840</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q5850</TRANSISTOR> are TB0T, TB1T, TB2T respectively. They go gto <CHIP>U5810</CHIP> before going to the SMC. What does <CHIP>U5810</CHIP> look like? Is it getting 3.3v on pin 1? Does it look like shit?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> tb0t error
threads.message: I just have seen bad conextion to the battery. Now it works ok and no errors more. Thanks
